title: No-Name Bot
description: My open source project was used as a source in a paper from Tufts University about the economic impact of Sneakerbots

title: ACT Data Visualization
description: A Data Visualization I created was used to emphasize the importance of high standardized test scores in the college application process

title: SciKitLearn Contribution
description: One of my open-source contributions to the popular Machine Learning framework SciKitLearn was merged on December 21st, 2017

title: US Patent #62815758
description: In March 2019, I filed and was approved for a provisional patent titled: "Apparatus, Method and Article for Prevention of Proximity-Based Device Authentication within a Defined Radius"

title: Best Mobile Hack at HackTech 2019
description: Our project "Ride Caring" was given the Best Mobile Hack award at the California Institute of Technology in March 2019

title: Best Hack that Acts on the Physical World
description: Presented by Uber's Advanced Technology Group at Caltech in March 2019

title: Best IoT Hack at HackTech 2019
description: Our project "Ride Caring" was given Best IoT Hack by Qualcomm at Caltech in March 2019

title: Best Use of the Eventbrite API at VandyHacks 2018
description: My project "EventbriteLocal" was given Best use of the EventBrite API at Vanderbilt University in November 2018

title: Best Use of SnapKit at UGAHacks 2019
description: Our project "Guardian Angel" won the Best use of the Snapchat SDK in February 2019

title: Best Use of Google Cloud Platform at AuburnHacks 2019
description: Our project "True Resume" won the Best use of the Google Cloud Platform in February 2019

title: 1st Place at HackGT 2018
description: My project "Telemetry" won the First Place award presented by NCR Corporation in November 2018

title: Best Voice Hack at HackGT 2018
description: Presented by Citi Bank at the Georgia Institute of Technology in November 2018

title: 1st Place NCR Midnight Challenge at HackGSU
description: My cash register emulator was given the 1st Place award at the NCR Midnight Challenge at HackGSU

title: Best Integrated Device at HackGSU 2018
description: Our project "Blind Date" was given the Best Integrated Device award at HackGSU in October 2018

title: Finalist at MedHacks 2018
description: My project "my.Doctor" was a finalist at the Johns Hopkins University Medical Hackathon in September 2018

title: 1st Place Overall at ColaHacks 2018
description: Our project "Alexa UofSC" was given first place overall at the University of South Carolina Hackathon in April 2018

title: Best Voice Hack at ColaHacks 2018
description: Our project "Alexa UofSC" was given the Best Voice Hack award at the University of South Carolina Hackathon in April 2018

title: Finalist at HackGT 2017
description: Our project "HackATeam" was a finalist at the Georgia Tech Hackathon in Fall 2017
